a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Value of 1 tonne of antimony¹, in constant 1998 US$ per tonne.
Data source: USGS - Historical Statistics for Mineral and Material Commodities (2023)
Note: This data is adjusted for inflation.
1. Antimony: Antimony is a metal that is mixed with others to form alloys to be used in pipes, motors, car parts, and batteries. It’s also used in the
textile industry, where it’s added to plastics, rubber, and other materials to make them less likely to catch fire.
